page.title: 18CHANGING TIMES 2
page.content: "I came to Borehamwood in 1952, so I have lived here for 33 years. The main changes I have seen are the massive increase in population and a steady growth in the number of shops. Of course, there have been some less satisfactory changes - now there's very little to do in the evenings apart from going to one of the many pubs. I really miss the cinema since it closed - going to a film at the Civic Hall doesn't have anything like the same atmosphere. Also the cost of things has changed out of all proportion - when I came here you could get into the cinema for twopence (1p.) and to the football ground for threepence! You can't do that these days!"
